title: India’s rare earth challenge: Why China leads and what comes next
description:
Rare earth elements are no longer just technical materials. They are becoming tools of power in global geopolitics.
This video explains how China came to dominate rare-earth processing, why these minerals now sit at the centre of trade wars, defence planning, and clean-energy transitions, and what strategic choices India faces as demand for electric vehicles, renewable energy, and advanced weapons systems rises.

The video draws on an in-depth eBook that brings together journalists, policy analysts, engineers, and industry experts to examine India’s rare-earth dilemma, China’s leverage, and the options still on the table.

If you want a deeper understanding of how critical minerals are shaping India’s economic security and geopolitical future, you can explore the eBook here: https://www.thehindu.com/premium/ebook/

Script: Shikha Kumari A 
Voice over: Jude Francis Weston

Two modules, from Pune and North India, handled logistics and execution. Several accused are now under arrest.

description: A former ISRO employee, Nagesh Ishwar Rao, was arrested in Bengaluru for allegedly strangling his wife, Sandhya Shri, to death. Police revealed Rao cited anxieties about his wife's future as his motive. The couple's daughter, residing in the US, has been notified. An investigation into the tragic incident is ongoing.

description: South Africa secured a commanding six-wicket victory over the UAE, boosting their morale heading into the T20 World Cup Super Eight stage. This "root-and-branch" transformation demands new skills in AI engineering and orchestration, while roles like front-end developers and QA testers are expected to shrink. Companies face the challenge of reskilling their workforce for these evolving AI-centric roles.

description: Google AI CEO Demis Hassabis stated that AI systems solving complex Maths Olympiad problems do not prove general intelligence. Hassabis emphasized the need for AI that learns continuously and plans for the future.

Live stream to wall climbs: Bihar Class X board exams open in chaos
description: Bihar School Examination Board exams commenced with significant disruptions. A Facebook Live video from a Siwan exam centre raised security concerns. Students across districts attempted to scale walls to enter centres after arriving late. Incidents of cheating were also reported. Authorities are investigating the breaches and ensuring exam integrity.

title: Why China's Gen Z are choosing to parent stuffed toys over real babies
description: Young Chinese women are embracing "painless parenthood" by raising life-sized cotton dolls, offering nurturing joy without the financial and career burdens of real motherhood. This trend, fueled by fandom and a desire for emotional fulfillment, allows them to experience motherhood's warmth and express creativity in a judgment-free environment, redefining adulthood on their own terms.
